column4: a small crisis here. I installed kubuntu with apt-get a few weeks ago just to see what the fuzz was about. Never liked it. But after yesterdays apt-get upgrade, my bootsplash is blue and says kubuntu instead of the lovely ubuntu logo.
how do I fix this? (want to keep kde-things because I often find kde-apps I like)
didn't help getting rid of the kubuntu-desktop package
you can change the splash screen :) lemme find the link...
:) I know I can change it. But I can never seem to learn how to use initrd-commands
i use a program actually.  Gnome SPash Screen Pref... located under system->preferences->spash screen
ahh.. I could disable the splash screen altogether. :) lovely.
I really don't like bootsplash, you see.
but that app, is it just to insert a jpg (or whatever)?
http://www.gnome-look.org/ has some really good screens. but if you really dont like them, thats ok too. hmm i wonder if it speeds anything up not having them?
I would love to have a picture of my daugher as bootsplash
it can be done
the app accepted it and activated it.. I'll try..
you misunderstood. That app was to control the login splash in gnome. I want to change the bootsplash, the graphic show when the computer is booting (before you can log in)
you mean where you select OS? Grub Screen?
between that and gdm login, yes. :) Where you see services get started.
i'll look into it now. I definetly want to change that too.
seems that screen is called usplash ? ....
seems like that, yes. But how to change it? I suspect we have to make a new initrd-image for the kernel
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/USplashCustomizationHowto
still reading :) https://wiki.ubuntu.com/USplashCustomizationHowto
